instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [820-00928-A] Help identifying blown component
threads.message:
I am getting 20.21V @ 0.00A when plugged in. Disassembled and found this component. I have tried searching for this component based on the inscription but I just could get any results. Any help or pointers are appreciated!

[IMG]https://attachments.servably.com/uploads/repairshopr/file/22357478/photo.jpg?Expires=1655142282&Signature=grG08HLpNgpDEOIJQonkB5EA14w1-p~jwrFA6IAIb7tZtxcm-6PENoJxOaxoIHzeEU61fLdHAuRRxdcmmYrIpZFYhDY1oSwBe1D9gVBCBXzFJrWxaJFV1H2wyyFlhjTt4pj6zKF8Tlt9tNuarN8K9vIWLxjdJmvgpH4ssQtCqZkPC1MDobuGOtHd5hbOMvL5d6IymM5z8os4OKrkWi2ecUKZsu7ZuQ59LheZrbfs4HxUHeh7jwa7HEH5KfbA3H7gjYRcQEtl5OAf~GPAz2USmIcECCy~76GAeDWIXVbB6ecCTWez3zLrCUZmh9eBV~4Jq3O7JfuiJ3rls6lt2Cp9vA__&Key-Pair-Id=APKAJP5EFGM7ZG2557SA[/IMG]

threads.title: [820-00928-A] Help identifying blown component
threads.message:
Learn how to use boardview and schematic.
It is CA601, 33uF/16V...

threads.title: [820-00928-A] Help identifying blown component
threads.message:
Thanks! I have gotten the software and the schematic. Would you have a recommendation on where to get a replacement other than from a donor board? As far as I can find the [URL='https://www.mouser.com/ProductDetail/KEMET/T525B336M016ATE070?qs=w%2Fv1CP2dgqqduVm87%2Fd8Yw%3D%3D']T525B336M016ATE070[/URL] is the closest component to the spec available in the schematic. Would this work?

Thank you!

threads.title: [820-00928-A] Help identifying blown component
threads.message:
You can get a replacement from older MacBook scrap boards.
Even 68uF/16V is good, if you have space to put it there.
